meanings.definition: A section of text in a religious book, especially the Bible, that forms a coherent unit.
meanings.sent1: The students studied different pericopes from the Bible in their religious class.
meanings.sent2: The priest read a pericope during the church service.
meanings.sent3: The pericopes in the Bible are like puzzle pieces that fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent4: Her life story unfolded like a series of pericopes, each revealing a new chapter.
meanings.sent5: The pericopes in the holy book were like colorful gems, each shining with its own meaning.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'pericope', meaning a passage from a religious text.
meanings.sent1: The scholars analyzed various pericopes to understand the religious text better.
meanings.sent2: In the library, you can find many pericopes from different religious books.
meanings.sent3: The pericopes on the shelf seemed to whisper ancient wisdom to those who read them.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a collection of pericopes, each holding a different insight.
meanings.sent5: The pericopes, like tiny windows, offered glimpses into the spiritual world.
